pros: Great, friendly atmosphere, encouragement and support from manager. Flexible work hours.
cons: Social care is a challenging sector with regulators etc

job_title: Social Care Worker in Dublin, Dublin
pros: Service users are nice sometimes and you can have good days out
cons: Company doesn't care at all about staff. No appreciation of any kind. You will be verbally and sometimes physically abused by service users and the company basically doesn't care. Not great pay either, very poor AL and lots of unsociable hours.

pros: A good manager but very poor senior management
cons: Company don't care about staff at all. Morale extremely low.
The salary and not being able to work from home

pros: Good staff team, amazing service users, can be a very rewarding role
cons: High staff turnover, job stress, low wage, incorrect job title, too many responsibilities

pros: Flexibility and a lot of learning oportunities

review_title: Lol at the managers and stooges reviews
pros: Staff turn over has always been high but over last year it's crazy I like working with the clients pity management dont care.
cons: I would not recommend this company to anyone be it working and certainly would never let them near any of my children due to management incompetence and laziness.

job_title: Social Care Worker in Dublin, Dublin
pros: Good Service, Service Users well cared for and supported. New pay Increments yearly, good supervision and support. Good place to learn good practice. One to one client working ratio.
cons: Few opportunities to progress unless you are willing to agree with everything management say. Want “Yes” people in management always. CEO likes to micromanage everything and is quite power hungry. Organisation can be petty about spending on certain things which leads to issues. Short sighted and it ends up costing them more in the long run.

pros: Great hours, build good relationships, develop good experience
cons: Late to bring in pay scale, training in head office, staff turnover
